properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 17 at 10:35AM CST by NWS Chicago IL
properties.description:
An area of light to moderate snow across portions of northwest and
north central Illinois as of 1030 AM, including the greater
Rockford area, was lifting northward and beginning to diminish in
intensity. Moderate snow with visibility under one mile will be
possible through about 11 AM near the Wisconsin border. Area web
cams indicate mostly wet main roads, but slush on some secondary
roads. With temperatures around or just above freezing, patchy
slick spots will be possible through about noon on untreated,
elevated, and less heavily traveled roads. Motorists are advised
to leave extra travel time and reduce speed.

NWSheadline: Snow Winding Down but Patchy Slick Spots Possible
